Questions

1.What is the difference between AFY, OYA, and YFE?

  • Adventure For Youth

    (AFY) participants go whitewater rafting on the Snake River, experience challenging activities on the BYU-Idaho campus, and do baptism at the Rexburg Temple. Devotionals, dances, and counselor-led gospel discussions help complete this adventure.

  • Outdoor Youth Adventure

    (OYA) is held at Badger Creek Ranch located at the base of the Teton Mountains. Participants camp in tents or teepees. Activities include horseback ridding, whitewater rafting, with challenging outdoor workshops, group activities, devotionals, and daily scripture study.

  • Youth For Excellence

    (YFE) in Palmyra, New York, is a different kind of adventure where participants experience a hands-on approach to studying LDS Church history. Explore Palmyra during this 5-day adventure with a seasoned CES instructor as your personal tour guide.

(Return to questions)

2.Where do I find more information about EFY?

Please visit EFY's web site at efy.byu.edu for more information about the EFY program.

(Return to questions)

3.How do I switch my registration from EFY to AFY, OYA, or YFE?

EFY is administered by Continuing Education at BYU in Provo, while AFY, OYA, and YFE are administered by the Community Connections office at BYU-Idaho. Funds are not transferable between the two universities. You may register at any time for AFY, OYA, or YFE, but that registration is completely independent of EFY. You may transfer between AFY, OYA, and YFE but there is a transfer fee of $25.

(Return to questions)

4.What ages may attend AFY, OYA, and YFE?

Participants for AFY and OYA should be youth between the ages of 14 and 18 while participants for YFE should be youth between the ages of 16 and 19.

All participants should be the minimum age by the first day of the session they attend and should not exceed the maximum age before the first day of the session they will attend.

(Return to questions)

5.How many roommates can I request?

AFY youth may request one roommate to a room with six in an apartment. OYA youth can request up to four roommates per tent.  YFE can have up to three roommates.

Notice: We try our best to accommodate roommate and group requests. However, Community Connections reserves the right to make roommate or group assignments according to the needs of the program. All requests are due two weeks prior to the program start date.To make a roommate request or group request, email Community Connections Youth Programs at youthprograms@byui.edu.

(Return to questions)

6.I want to room with my friend/cousin/brother/sister who is older/younger. Is that possible?

Roommates must be the same gender for all programs. We try to assign roommates or groups so that members are the same age or no more than one year apart. For YFE participants, there are no group restrictions for roommates.

(Return to questions)

7.What do I do if I can't complete the registration process?

Please contact our office at (208) 496-1222. We would be happy to help you complete the registration process, and we do apologize for any inconveniences.

(Return to questions)

8.How do I get on the waiting list for your Youth Programs?

If the program is full, click to sign-up for the openings notification for the session you would like to attend. When an opening is available, all those signed up will receive an email notifying them that a spot is open. The first one to respond will get the available opening.

(Return to questions)

9.What is your Refund Policy?

There will be a $25 processing fee for each refund. If you drop within three weeks of the starting date, the processing fee will be $100. If you are within one week of the starting date of your session, no refund will be granted.

(Return to questions)

10. Is there a shuttle from Salt Lake or the Idaho Falls Airport?

The Salt Lake Express operates a special early Monday morning shuttle for AFY in addition to their regular Salt Lake City departures. This shuttle departs from the west side of the LDS Conference Center at 7:30 a.m. and from the Salt Lake Airport at 8 a.m. each Monday. The shuttle is scheduled to arrive at BYU-Idaho at 12:35 p.m. at the west side of the Hart Building. There will be counselors and signs posted to help guide the youth to the Manwaring Center. Check-ins will begin at 1 p.m. in room 127 of the Manwaring Center. Most participants take the 4:30 p.m. shuttle on Friday to return to Salt Lake. This departs from the west side of the Hart Building. If you make your reservation online, enter the Discount Code of ZAFY11 to receive a discounted rate. In order to get the discount you must leave from the above mentioned locations in Salt Lake. The discount will not work from any other city or location. This price is only valid for AFY, OYA, and EFY participants. Additional travel information is available at www.byui.edu/pr/StudentTravel.

Shuttle Service from Idaho Falls, Idaho:

Community Connections offers a shuttle service between the Idaho Falls Airport and the BYU-Idaho campus for participants arriving by plane.  Shuttle fees are $20 per person each way. The deadline for shuttle reservations is one week prior to the program start date. A reservation is required to ensure shuttle service, and can be made online at www.byui.edu/cc/youth/travel.htm.

  • Arrival Shuttles
    • Monday - 12:30 p.m.
  • Departure Shuttles
    • Friday - 3:30 p.m.

What do I do if I have a unique question?

Community Connections is interested in any questions you might have about its programs. Please e-mail any questions you might have to Youth Programs.
